newValue: In some areas, such as Region A, predicted shaking intensities aligned well with observed data.
description: Predicted shaking intensities aligning well with observed data in Region A

newValue: However, in Region B, significant underestimation occurred due to the Valley Amplification Effect, which was not accounted for in the model.
description: Significant underestimation in Region B due to unaccounted Valley Amplification Effect

newValue: Underestimation of Potential Losses
description: Identified underestimation of potential losses

newValue: Discrepancies in ground movement predictions directly impact damage estimates.
description: Ground movement prediction discrepancies impact damage estimates

newValue: For example, a high-rise steel-frame building was initially forecasted to experience a 50% Mean Damage Ratio (MDR) at 0.9g PGA, but actual ground acceleration of 1.4g PGA resulted in an MDR of 78%, meaning loss expectations were significantly understated.
description: Example of loss expectations understatement in a high-rise building

newValue: Unpriced Risk in Certain Areas
description: Identification of unpriced risks in specific areas

newValue: Areas where seismic activity has been underestimated may have inadequate insurance coverage or mispriced policies, leading to unexpected financial exposure.
description: Potential financial exposure due to underestimated seismic activity

newValue: However, regions such as Metropolitan X, where amplification effects are less pronounced, may not face the same risk adjustments.
description: Variation in risk adjustments based on region characteristics

newValue: Adjustments to Risk Models
description: Necessity for adjustments in risk models based on assessment findings

newValue: Industry assessments revealed that damage vulnerability curves in the model may be understated, particularly at moderate intensity levels where partial structural failures occur.
description: Identification of understated damage vulnerability curves

newValue: Comparing the model with Y's seismic research showed a higher vulnerability index, prompting an updated risk framework for 2025.
description: Comparison to research leading to an updated risk framework
